p: To conclude, the recent establishment of Ae. albopictus in Tunisia poses the threat of emergence of CHIKV and to a lesser extent, of ZIKV and DENV considering the vector competence data obtained. Introductions of viremic travelers from endemic countries for these viruses via migrant workers or tourists may initiate local transmission when environmental conditions are favorable to sustain high vector densities at proximity of a high proportion of immunologically naive humans. Therefore, control of vectors and surveillance of febrile travelers should be reinforced during the season of high attendance of Tunisia by tourists.
